channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: One in 10 Afghan children under five malnourished, 45 percent stunted: UN
item.description: Poor nutrition rife in country plagued by economic, humanitarian climate crises over two years since Taliban's return.

item.title: Taiwan hit by strongest earthquake in 25 years, killing 9: What we know
item.description: Taiwan's earthquake kills at least nine people, injures nearly 900, with 77 trapped in tunnels and collapsed buildings.

item.title: Uganda’s Constitutional Court rejects petition against anti-gay law
item.description: Anti-Homosexuality Act 2023 imposes penalties of up to life in prison for consensual same-sex relations.

item.title: Sri Lanka beat Bangladesh by 192 runs to sweep Test series 2-0
item.description: Bangladesh's batting faltered as they lost both Tests by big margins against their regional rivals.

item.title: Deadly earthquake topples buildings in Taiwan
item.description: Buildings have been toppled in Taiwan after it was hit by its most powerful earthquake in 25 years.

item.title: Senegal’s Faye appoints ally Ousmane Sonko as prime minister
item.description: New prime minister is popular politician who was barred from the March 24 elections, prompting him to support Faye.

item.title: Ronaldo scores second hat-trick in 3 days in Al Nassr’s Saudi league win
item.description: Ronaldo leads the Saudi league's goal-scoring chart with 29 goals, but Al Nassr trail Al Hilal by 12 points.

item.title: Western allies face threat of complicity if support for Israel continues
item.description: Experts say Israel's Western allies are risking sanction from the ICJ if arms shipments continue .

item.title: Why will low birthrate in Europe trigger ‘Staggering social change’?
item.description: Lancet report says Western countries will be forced to open borders wide to migration if economies are to survive.

item.title: NATO foreign ministers to discuss $108bn military aid fund for Ukraine
item.description: NATO foreign ministers to hold preliminary talks as they seek to forge a five-year support package for Ukraine.

item.title: Israel’s war on Gaza: List of key events, day 180
item.description: Netanyahu says Israel mistakenly killed seven people working for aid group as global condemnation of strikes grows.

item.title: Taiwan rocked by most powerful quake in 25 years
item.description: The earthquake was the strongest since one of magnitude 7.6 struck in September 1999, killing about 2,400 people.

item.title: Biden rebukes Israel, says he’s ‘outraged’ over killing of Gaza aid workers
item.description: US president issues some of his strongest criticism of Israel after killings of seven aid workers in Israeli air strike.

item.title: North Korea says Kim Jong Un oversaw test of new hypersonic weapon
item.description: State media said the missile – named Hwasong-16B – was a key piece of the country's nuclear war deterrent.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 769
item.description: As the war enters its 769th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: At least nine dead, hundreds injured after Taiwan hit by strong earthquake
item.description: Taiwanese authorities say nine people killed in Hualien County, including three hikers, and more than 800 injured.

item.title: Mexican President Lopez Obrador responds to mayoral candidate’s slaying
item.description: The death of Bertha Gisela Gaytán has renewed concern over violence in the lead-up to the nationwide election on June 2.

item.title: Why Biden’s White House iftar unravelled amid Gaza war
item.description: Sources tell Al Jazeera the White House cancelled Ramadan meal after many Muslim invitees declined to attend.

item.title: Israel’s planned Al Jazeera ban condemned
item.description: Press freedom groups are condemning a new Israeli law that would ban Al Jazeera’s right to operate in Israel and Gaza.

item.title: Biden denounces Florida abortion ruling as ‘outrageous’ as state vote looms
item.description: US state's Supreme Court upheld a 15-week abortion ban, but also allowed a ballot measure on abortion access to proceed.

item.title: Portugal’s minority government takes office, faces fragmented parliament
item.description: With just 80 seats in 230-seat parliament, the government will need the support of the opposition to pass legislation.

item.title: Biden and Xi hold first discussions since November, talk Taiwan and tech
item.description: Call comes ahead of flurry of diplomatic engagement, with both US and China maintaining they want to reduce friction.

item.title: Staying Behind in Gaza
item.description: "This is our land. This is our home."

item.title: Gaza infrastructure damages estimated at $18.5bn in UN-World Bank report
item.description: The initial assessment is likely to be an underestimate of the real damages, losses and needs in Gaza.

item.title: Four hundred years on, Mexico’s oldest Black community struggles to survive
item.description: Climate change, poverty threaten to wash away the coastal community founded by fugitive slaves.
